publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3710# Ms Sandra White: Digital Hearing Aids-That the Parliament notes the recent announcement by the Northern Ireland Executive that it will have in place by March 2004 a service to supply digital hearing aids to those who would benefit from them; further notes with concern that Scotland, which once led the UK in audiology services, will now be the only part of the UK without any commitment to fully modernised audiology services, and therefore considers that the Scottish Executive should take, as a matter of urgency, measures and make resources available for the provision of digital hearing aids to all those who require them.
S1M-3710# Digital Hearing Aids (lodged on 13 December 2002) Tommy Sheridan*, Shona Robison*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3710# Digital Hearing Aids (lodged on 13 December 2002) Mr Andrew Welsh*, Michael Matheson*, Alex Neil*
S1M-3710# Digital Hearing Aids (lodged on 13 December 2002) Robert Brown*, Dennis Canavan*, Tricia Marwick*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Irene McGugan*
S1M-3710# Digital Hearing Aids (lodged on 13 December 2002) Nora Radcliffe*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Mr Mike Rumbles*
S1M-3710# Digital Hearing Aids (lodged on 13 December 2002) Brian Adam*, John Scott*
S1M-3710# Digital Hearing Aids (lodged on 13 December 2002) Christine Grahame*
S1M-3710# Digital Hearing Aids (lodged on 13 December 2002) Linda Fabiani*, Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-3710# Digital Hearing Aids (lodged on 13 December 2002) Mr Duncan Hamilton*
S1M-3710# Digital Hearing Aids (lodged on 13 December 2002) Mr Kenneth Gibson*

S1M-3710# Ms Sandra White: Digital Hearing Aidsâ€”That the Parliament notes the recent announcement by the Northern Ireland Executive that it will have in place by March 2004 a service to supply digital hearing aids to those who would benefit from them; further notes with concern that Scotland, which once led the UK in audiology services, will now be the only part of the UK without any commitment to fully modernised audiology services, and therefore considers that the Scottish Executive should take, as a matter of urgency, measures and make resources available for the provision of digital hearing aids to all those who require them. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Shona Robison, Donald Gorrie, Mr Andrew Welsh, Michael Matheson, Alex Neil, Robert Brown, Dennis Canavan, Tricia Marwick, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Irene McGugan, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr Mike Rumbles, Brian Adam, John Scott, Christine Grahame, Linda Fabiani, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Kenneth Gibson
